name: Monopoly (itch)
description:
This 2-player Monopoly game is a simplified version of the original board game of the same name.

Playing the game in full screen is recommended.

The rules are slightly different from the original, so please refer to the instructions below.

INSTRUCTIONS: Start/Setup:
  • 2 players: brown Wheelbarrow and gray Top Hat
  • Both players start at "Go" tile and go around counterclockwise
  • Both players start off with $2000 and no properties
  • Top Hat always starts first
  • Both players take turns using the mouse to play the game
  • All properties and railroads cost $200 to buy
  • All utilities cost $150 to buy
  • Tile deeds of the 2 players are in their respective top corners
  • Text directly above buttons at bottom center indicates whose turn it is
  • Instructions appear inside board of tiles, along with the dice and current tile
  • Cost and rent of current tile is displayed in top center
  • Non-clickable buttons are faded out
Game play:
  • Click the light green "Roll" button to roll dice, which will appear inside board of tiles
  • If rolled doubles, player gets to roll again
  • If landed on property, railroad, or utility, player have option to buy the tile by clicking the light blue "Buy" button within 5 seconds
  • If landed on opponent's tile, player must pay owner rent that is at least twice the buying cost of the tile
  • If landed on owned tile, rent on that tile increases by $100
  • When tile is bought, it is added to the list of player's tile deeds
  • If player owns all properties of the same color, railroads, or utilities, then rent increases by $200 for all of the tiles in the group
  • Jail:
    • If landed on "Jail" tile, player is stuck in jail for three turns
    • If rolled three consecutive doubles, player is sent directly to jail for three turns
    • If landed on "Go To Jail" tile, player is sent directly to jail for three turns
    • Players are released from jail on the third turn after being jailed
    • Players can escape jail by rolling doubles, after which they move ahead the number they rolled, but cannot roll again
    • Players can also escape by buying their way out of jail in the following two turns, immediately after which the player gets to move forward
    • While in jail, players can still collect rent from other players
  • If landed on "Pay Taxes" tile, player must pay $200 in taxes
  • If landed on "Chance" tile, player receives a random amount of money between $100 and $400
  • If landed on "Free Parking" tile, nothing happens
  • If landed on or passed"Go" tile, player receives $300
  • Players only have 5 seconds to buy tiles or buy their way out of jail, after which these options are not available for the turn
  • When prompted by instructions text, click the light pink "End Turn" button to end the turn
  • When one or more of the players go bankrupt, the game ends and the player with the most money wins
  • Once the game is over, press the "R" key to restart the game
  • When in doubt, follow the instructions in the center of the board
